description: The US Justice Department won’t pressure social media companies to remove or block content when the government shares information about foreign threats to national security or elections, after claims that platforms were previously coerced.
title: DOJ Vows No Pre-Election Pressure on Meta, X to Fight Foreign Meddling

description: El sistema para decidir sobre los casos de asilo está fallando, y no solo porque esté desbordado. Habrá que hacer algo drástico para arreglar un proceso que está viciado de raíz.
title: La justicia no viene al caso en las cortes de inmigración de EE.UU.

description: Kamala Harris is proposing a ten-fold increase in the small business tax deduction for startup costs, a new weapon in her arsenal as she vies with Donald Trump to show voters who can best assuage their anxieties about the economy.
title: Harris to Expand Small Business Tax Relief to Boost Startups

description: The system for deciding asylum cases is failing, and not only because it’s overwhelmed. Something drastic will have to be done to fix a process that’s flawed at its very core.
title: Justice Is Beside the Point in America’s Immigration Courts

description: Donald Trump signaled his support for marijuana legalization in his home state of Florida, where voters have a measure on the ballot that would allow recreational use, marking a significant policy shift for the former president.
title: Trump in Shift Backs Marijuana Legalization If Done ‘Correctly’

description: New York and its local governments outside New York City will pay $900 million more into the state’s pension fund in the coming fiscal year after benefit sweeteners were approved by state lawmakers and public employee salaries rose.
title: New York State and Local Pension Payments to Rise $900 Million

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, economy reporter Michael Sasso looks at Democrats’ electoral hopes in the South. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Harris Looks to Break Republican Grip on Southern States

description: The US Justice Department sent subpoenas to Nvidia Corp. and other companies as it seeks evidence that the chipmaker violated antitrust laws, an escalation of its investigation into the dominant provider of AI processors.
title: Nvidia Gets DOJ Subpoena in Escalating Antitrust Probe

description: Judges on Mexico’s Supreme Court decided to join labor protests against President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador’s judicial reform plans, according to a person with direct knowledge of the matter.
title: Supreme Court Justices Join Mexico Strikes Against AMLO’s Reform

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin is cautious about where he travels abroad these days. He had avoided visiting the 124 countries that are members of the International Criminal Court, given that they are obliged to honor a warrant for his arrest for alleged war crimes in Ukraine. However, ICC member Mongolia failed to enforce the warrant when Putin paid a call Sept. 3, after giving him advance notice that he wouldn’t be detained. The visit underscored the unlikelihood that Putin will be brought t
title: How War Crimes Charges Limits Putin’s Travels, or Not

description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. economists gamed out the potential economic implications of a Republican or Democratic victory in the November elections, cautioning that US GDP faces a hit in the case of a win for Donald Trump.
title: Goldman Sees US GDP Hit If Trump Wins, Boost If Democrats Sweep

description: The Democratic Republic of Congo canceled a $1.2 billion project to set up a national biometric ID system, months after a government watchdog warned of cost overruns and possible funding irregularities.
title: Congo Cancels $1.2 Billion ID System Contract After Costs Spiral

description: The Biden administration granted the first liquefied natural gas export license since the Energy Department halted LNG export permits in January, even as the agency appeals a federal court’s ruling to overturn the temporary moratorium.
title: Biden Grants First New LNG Approval Since Freezing Permits

description: Truck drivers are blocking some of the main roads into Bogota to protest against Colombia’s first diesel price hike in nearly five years, forcing schools to cancel classes and leaving workers stuck in traffic.
title: Truck Drivers Paralyze Colombia’s Capital After Diesel Price Hike

description: Donald Trump is facing a series of crucial rulings in his New York hush money case that will determine if he’ll be sentenced before the November presidential election, and prosecutors are pushing back.
title: Trump Faces Rulings on Whether He Can Stop Hush Money Sentencing

description: Former Trade Representative Michael Froman discusses what the world can expect from Kamala Harris or Donald Trump, and how Harris is breaking from Joe Biden.
title: What Foreign Policy Under Harris or Trump May Look Like

description: Uganda’s National Unity Platform, the country’s main opposition party, said its leader Robert Kyagulanyi was shot in the leg on Tuesday in an incident on the outskirts of the capital, Kampala.
title: Uganda’s Main Opposition Party Says Leader Bobi Wine Shot in Leg

description: President Emmanuel Macron’s extended deliberations over who to appoint as France’s new prime minister are curbing the time available for lawmakers to make any significant changes to the budget, according to the chair of the National Assembly’s finance committee.
title: Macron’s Delay in Picking Premier Cuts Time for Tweaks to Budget

description: The German government plans to cut its stake in Commerzbank AG as it seizes on a recent share rally to initiate an exit from the lender it rescued over a decade ago.
title: Germany to Sell Down Commerzbank Stake After Share Rally

description: Linda Sun, a former top aide to New York Governor Kathy Hochul, was arrested on federal charges that she acted as an unregistered foreign agent for China.
title: Ex-Top Aide to NY Governor Is Arrested on Foreign Agent Charges

description: Brazil’s ban of social-media platform X may be an economic setback for owner Elon Musk, but it’s also a potential political opportunity for the billionaire and his right-wing allies.
title: Musk’s Right-Wing Allies Seize on Brazil X Ban Heading Into Elections

description: Three Ukrainian cabinet ministers submitted their resignations on Tuesday amid speculation of a broader government reshuffle as the war-battered nation confronts a growing barrage of Russian missile strikes.
title: Three Ukrainian Ministers Offer to Resign in Broad Reshuffle

description: Demonstrators formed a human chain to block access to Mexico’s lower house in a protest against President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador’s judicial reform bill, which lawmakers are scheduled to debate on Tuesday.
title: Protesters Block Off Mexican Congress Ahead of Judicial Debate

description: China’s top electric-vehicle maker BYD Co. won’t announce a major plant investment in Mexico until at least after the US election, according to people familiar with the matter, as shifting American policy forces global businesses into wait-and-see mode.
title: China’s BYD to Pause Mexico Plant Until After US Election

description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer is scrambling to find an investment minister after the Labour government’s first choice pulled out because the role would have required him to make costly changes to his own business ties, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Labour Seeks Investment Minister After Party Favorite Pulls Out

description: Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich said higher war spending would be financed through budget cutbacks and increased revenues rather than a wider deficit, the outline of a long-delayed fiscal plan.
title: Israel Finance Minister Commits to Cutbacks to Help Fund War

description: An adviser to the governor of the Bank of Russia has been tapped to represent her country on the International Monetary Fund’s executive board, even as she is under US sanctions.
title: Sanctioned Aide to Bank of Russia Head Tapped for IMF Board Seat

description: Vice President Kamala Harris, who’s energized Democratic donors since emerging atop her party’s ticket, is moving $24.5 million down ballot to help candidates in Senate, House and state races, according to a person familiar with the campaign’s plans.
title: Harris Shares War Chest by Sending $24.5 Million to Other Races

description: Spain will name Jose Luis Escriva, currently the minister for digital affairs, as the new Bank of Spain governor, newspaper Expansion reported, citing people it didn’t identify.
title: Spain to Name Escriva New Central Bank Governor, Expansion Says

description: The Libyan central banker at the heart of a power struggle between the OPEC nation’s rival governments said a deal appears imminent to resolve the dispute and spur the resumption of vital oil output.
title: Libyan Central Banker Sees Deal Soon That Will Restore Oil Flows

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is sticking to his hard-line approach on Hamas, in the face of mass protests at home over the killing of six hostages and the suspension of some British arms licenses.
title: Netanyahu Refuses to Budge on War Despite Protests Over Hostages

description: As Donald Trump embraces cryptocurrency aficionados in search of votes and campaign contributions, the deepest pockets in the industry are conspicuously absent from the list of his donors.
title: How Coinbase Went From DC ‘Kids Table’ to Political Power Seat

description: Turkey is working toward teaming up with China to process a deposit of rare earth elements, a potential partnership that could make the country more appealing to Chinese manufacturers of electric vehicles and batteries.
title: Turkey Seeks Chinese Partnership on Rare Earth Elements for EVs

description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves defended her controversial decision to cut the winter fuel allowance for pensioners, saying it was needed to help restore order to the UK’s public finances.
title: UK’s Reeves Defends Controversial Cut to Winter Fuel Payments

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said Russian missiles killed at least 41 people in central Ukraine, in one of the deadliest strikes since the Kremlin’s invasion began in February 2022.
title: Zelenskiy Says Russian Strike Kills 41 in Central Ukraine

description: Flows remain in the narrow range they’ve occupied since the start of July
title: Russia’s Crude Shipments Edge Down to the Lowest in a Month

description: The remote province of La Rioja has created its own currency, the chacho, to try to revive its moribund economy.
title: New Argentine Currency Launched to Offset Milei’s Shock Therapy

description: The Philippines said it has monitored the highest number of Chinese ships in the South China Sea this year, as Beijing projects its naval power amid renewed tensions with Manila.
title: Philippines Spots 200 China Ships, Most This Year, Amid Tensions

description: Ukrainian National Anti-Corruption Bureau said on Tuesday that it has dismissed its first deputy director as a result of a disciplinary misstep.
title: Ukraine’s Anti-Graft Office Dismisses First Deputy Head

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Israel-Hamas Truce Deal Is Stuck on a Fence

description: Joy does not describe the Democratic National Convention that New York Gov. Kathy Hochul experienced.
title: NY’s Hochul Faces Last Chance to Show She’s Not a Drag on Democrats

description: The contest between the vice president and Donald Trump in Georgia and North Carolina is essentially tied, a stark turnaround from when Joe Biden was running.
title: Kamala Harris Has Energized Democrats So Much, They Think They Can Win the South

description: Botswana will hold a general election on Oct. 30, according to President Mokgweetsi Masisi, who will seek another term.
title: Botswana to Hold General Election on Oct. 30, President Says

description: The United Nations said it held talks between Libya’s rival governments on Monday in an attempt to resolve a crisis at the country’s central bank that has triggered a blockade of oil production and exports from the OPEC nation.
title: UN Holds Talks in Tripoli to Resolve Libya’s Central Bank Crisis

description: Climate negotiators from the US and China will resume talks Wednesday in Beijing on deepening emissions cuts and transition funding, as the top two polluters aim to find agreement on key issues ahead of November’s global UN summit.
title: China-US Climate Talks to Resume From Wednesday in Beijing

description: Thailand’s new leader Paetongtarn Shinawatra reaffirmed her commitment to keep much of her party’s controversial plan to hand out 10,000 baht ($292) each to almost all adult Thais, and said her cabinet lineup is ready.
title: New Thai PM to Keep Cash Handout, Finalize Cabinet on Tuesday

description: Poland’s government has no plans to sell any major assets back into private hands after the previous nationalist administration significantly boosted the state’s role in the economy.
title: Poland Eyes Governance Boost for State Firms, Shuns Asset Sales

description: Nobody under 25 in Russia has known any other ruler than Vladimir Putin. The Kremlin is determined to ensure the new generation continues to be formed in the president’s image.
title: Putin Is Spending Big to Shape Russia’s Youth in His Own Image

description: Nine weeks before a presidential election with major implications for global trade, American companies remain as split as ever about whether the tariff barrage the US unleashed against $300 billion of imports from China is punishing their fiercest economic rival or backfiring at home.
title: US Golf Cart Industry Shows China Tariffs Are an Imperfect Tool

description: China remains the major foreign power with the biggest positive influence on Africa’s youth, a new survey shows, indicating the limitations of a drive by the US to bolster its standing on the continent.
title: China Retains Lead in Race for Influence Over Africa’s Youth, Survey Shows

description: A school bus in eastern China crashed into a group of students and parents on Tuesday morning, killing at least 11 and injuring 24.
title: China School Bus Ramming Kills at Least 11 Students, Parents

description: Russian leader Vladimir Putin is poised to meet with Mongolia’s president and other senior officials despite calls for his arrest under a warrant from the International Criminal Court related to alleged war crimes.
title: Putin Set to Meet Top Mongolian Leaders Despite Calls for Arrest

description: Australian businesses risk missing out on Southeast Asia’s looming economic boom, Foreign Minister Penny Wong said, expressing frustration at the struggle to spur more private investment in near neighbors.
title: Top Australia Diplomat Fears Firms Will Miss Southeast Asia Boom

description: A liquefied natural gas carrier is returning to the Arctic LNG 2 facility in Russia to load more of the super-chilled fuel, as Moscow presses ahead with exports despite tighter US sanctions.
title: Sanctioned Russian LNG Plant Prepares to Export Another Shipment

description: Outgoing President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador is poised to control the only branch of government that still eludes him in Mexico, ensuring the dominance of his Morena party for years to come. Such unchecked power would pose significant political and economic risks to a country that spent most of the 20th century under authoritarian rule.
title: AMLO and Sheinbaum Set to Consolidate Morena’s Power in Mexico

description: Australia’s success in virtually eliminating mpox within six months of an outbreak in 2022 is now being overshadowed by a sudden and alarming resurgence, highlighting the challenges ahead as the world braces for a potentially more dangerous strain.
title: Sydney’s Mpox Surge Offers Cautionary Tale as World Braces for New Strain
